page.title: 16A New House in Shiphay
page.content: We went to the Bovis Homes building site. Each house has two skins made from insulation blocks and red bricks. 5,000 bricks are used for each house. These come in packs of 400 and are moved by fork lift trucks. Roof trusses are ready made and held by steel nails. Concrete roof tiles slot together. The foundations are about 30cm deep and filled with ready mixed concrete. About 9cm from the ground a damp course is put between the blocks and bricks. Plaster board is stuck toi the interior. One house had two rooms up and two rooms down and would take 26 weeks to build at a cost of Â£30,000. The water pipes are made of copper and plastic. A bricklayer earns Â£3.50 for every 10 bricks layed and can earn Â£100 a day. In a year Bovis has built 250 houses on the Veille Park estate.
